title: Walt Disney Treasures The Chronological Donald Volume 1 (1934-19
description:
Plot:



    A collection of animated shorts starring Donald Duck. The volume begins with 'Donald and Pluto' from 1934 and ends with 'Chef Donald' from 1941. Also included is a tribute to Clarence Nash, the voice of Donald Duck.






    It was 1934 when the irascible Donald Duck came to life in a teeny bit of a part in 'The Wise Little Men' and proceeded to steal the show. From that point on nobody could hold him back, and the much-loved cranky character went on the most profilic of Walt's FAB FIVE. Now for the First Time, you can enjoy Donald in ALL of his STARRING SHORTS from 'Donald & Pluto' in 1936 to 'Chef Donald' in 1941. This Volume also includes insights into the origins and career of the belligerent 'bird' from Tony Aselmo, a renowned Disney Animator who apprenticed for 3 years with Clarence "Ducky" Nash, the originator of Donald's distinctive voice. Also features exclusive introductions by film historian, Leonald Maltin, making this 2 DVD Set a TIMELESS Collection from generations past for generations to come.
